titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Albert Heman Ely, Jr. Family Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Tom Hyry

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday May 4, 2019 at 07:11

did.unittitle: Albert Heman Ely, Jr. family papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers include correspondence, photographs, motion picture film, diaries, memorabilia, printed matter and other materials that document the family of Albert Heman Ely, Jr. and Constance Jennings Ely. The papers document three generations of Ely and Jennings family life, international travel, and the moral re-armament movement.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Day Ely Ravenscroft, 2005, 2007, and 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original motion picture films, as well as preservation masters and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers needing to view the original materials should consult the reference archivist for policies governing reproduction for access. There are no restrictions on use by researchers of DVDs in the collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by Albert Ely Heman, Jr., Constance Jennings Ely, and Day Ely Ravenscroft whether such works are at Yale or physically located elsewhere in the world. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Albert Heman Ely, Jr. Family Papers (MS 1843). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Albert Heman Ely, Jr. was born May 21, 1894, in New York City. He received a B.A. from Yale College in 1915 and an L.L.B. and an M.A. from Columbia University in 1917. He served in the United States Naval Reserve from 1917 to 1919, before practicing law for a variety of firms in New York City from 1919 to 1935. In 1930, Ely and his wife, Constance Jennings Ely met Frank Buchman, the leader of the Oxford Group, which came to be known as Moral Re-armament. The Elys became leaders in the movement and traveled extensively to Europe, Latin America, and Asia on its behalf. Albert Heman Ely, Jr. died September 28, 1964.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged in one section, Inventory, and one addition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers include correspondence, photographs, motion picture film, diaries, memorabilia, printed matter and other materials that document the family of Albert Heman Ely, Jr. and Constance Jennings Ely. The papers document three generations of Ely and Jennings family life, international travel, and the moral re-armament movement.

did.unittitle: Film shot by Albert H. Ely, Jr. documenting his travels, Moral Re-Armament, and family life

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Log book of films in Box 34 provides detailed information about the content of these films. Numbers in parentheses below reflect numbers written on individual film canisters by donor and correspond to descriptions in the Log book of films. Excerpts from some of these films are included on the various Ely Heritage Project DVDs in box 36. Some of the films have been transferred to Mini-DVCAM by Day Ely Ravenscroft as part of the Ely Heritage Project (see boxes 37-49).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: MRA-related information can be found elsewhere in this collection in notebooks, diaries, and correspondence. There are no restrictions on the use of original DVDs and VHS tape by researchers. Copes of these commercially produced materials cannot be made for researchers.

did.unittitle: The Forgotten Factor by Alan Thornhill

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The computer files are unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu . The request should outline the scope and purpose of the research project, why the researcher believes the material is relevant to their project, and contact information. If possible the request should also include a list of specific material of interest including collection, box, and folder numbers (or folder descriptions if folders are not numbered). The review may take several weeks. Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

did.unittitle: Bridge Builders: A Song of the Oxford Group, sheet music
Assembly of the Americas for the Moral Re-Armament of the World (Rio de Janeiro, Brazil), printed program

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Includes digitized materials from throughout the Albert Heman Ely, Jr. Family Papers and additional personal materials in the possession of Ely family members. Project is primarily the work of Day Ely Ravenscroft, daughter of Albert Heman Ely, Jr. and Constance Jennings Ely. Also includes additional commentary, lists, and stories supplied by Ravenscroft. There are no restrictions on use of the original DVDs by researchers.
